participant_1.background:
I read many mysteries last year to help me relax after a long day of teaching kindergarten.
i work for an architect firm.
I went on a quilting retreat in the mountains with my friends.
i have an autograph collection with more than 2000 signatures.
My work schedule is hectic and I have trouble staying in touch with my family.

participant_2.background:
I live in a city where the weather is unpredictable.
i am headed to university of michigan in the fall.
I'm passionate about music and I'm always looking for new ways to express myself.
my favorite show is tom and jerry.
i like to fly kites.

content.text: Hello! I'm a kindergarten teacher and I love mysteries. What do you do for a living?
Hello! I'm headed to University of Michigan in the fall to study music. What's your favorite mystery?
I like the Agatha Christie mysteries. They're so well written and suspenseful.
I've heard good things about those! I'm more into murder mysteries, so I've been reading a lot of books by James Patterson.
I've read a few of his books too. I like his writing style.
Me too! He's a great storyteller.
I wish I had more time to read. I'm so busy with work and family that I don't have much time for hobbies.
I know what you mean. I'm always trying to find time to practice my music.
I love quilting and I go on retreats with my friends. It's a great way to relax and spend time with people I love.
That sounds like a lot of fun! I've never been on a quilting retreat.
You should try it! It's a great way to meet new people and learn new things.
I might have to check it out! I'm always looking for new ways to express myself.
That's good to hear. I think everyone should have a hobby that they're passionate about.
I agree! It's important to have something to do that you enjoy.
